# Chord: Major 7th in C#

## Brief Description
The Major 7th chord in the key of C# is a C# major chord with the added seventh note, which is B#. This chord consists of the notes C#, E#, G#, and B#.

## Notes and Intervals
- C# (Root)
- E# (Major 3rd)
- G# (Perfect 5th)
- B# (Major 7th)

## Musical Flavor
The Major 7th chord in C# has a lush and sophisticated sound. It creates a dreamy and jazz-influenced quality to the music. Often used in jazz, R&B, and soul genres, this chord adds a sense of warmth and richness to compositions.

## Songs
1. **"Fly Me to the Moon" by Frank Sinatra** - This jazz standard features the Major 7th chord in C# within its harmonic progression, adding a sophisticated touch to the melody.
   
2. **"Don't Know Why" by Norah Jones** - The Major 7th chord in C# can be heard in the smooth and elegant accompaniment of this popular song, enhancing its mellow and soulful atmosphere.

3. **"The Nearness of You" by Hoagy Carmichael** - This classic ballad prominently utilizes the Major 7th chord in C#, infusing the piece with a romantic and nostalgic feel.
